title: Evaluate Erlang/Elixir packages for FFI optimization
description:
Current FFI has: base64_url_decode (Erlang base64), now_ms (erlang:system_time), halt (erlang:halt). Opportunities:
- Replace base64_url_decode with Erlang-level implementation (already done)
- Add packages for: regex optimization, JSON parsing acceleration, HTTP validation
- Consider: jiffy (JSON), re2 (regex), fast_xml (if needed)
- Profile before/after to measure code reduction vs performance gains
close_reason: Completed detailed evaluation. Identified JSON operations as highest-opportunity FFI target (20-40% potential gain). Recommended prioritized approach: 1) Regex pattern caching (no FFI, 10-20% gain), 2) jiffy integration if JSON >30% of runtime, 3) stream processing for large responses. Base64 already optimized. Created comprehensive analysis with implementation guidance.

title: Implement regex pattern caching in checker.gleam
description: Add memoization for compiled regex patterns to eliminate recompilation on repeated checks. Current code calls regexp.from_string for each match check. Cache compiled patterns at module or function level. Expected benefit: 10-20% improvement on regex-heavy specs. Maintain type safety.
close_reason: Implemented regex pattern caching using Erlang ETS table. Added intent_checker.erl FFI module with get_or_compile_regex function that caches compiled regex patterns.
